question: Absolutely, under no condition, is anyone in this family going to fall in love with that baby. Kiaya! We can't keep that baby. Mims, Ranon. Hey! I will not be ignored! This is bad. If we're caught with that little daikini it'll be the end of us. Careful, Ranon, I need that for the festival. Kiaya, what are we going to do?
answer: We're gonna give this baby a bath.

question: Burglekutt's right. There's not enough time to finish plowing. We'll lose everything and I'll end up working in the mines.
answer: Willow, do you think we should take her to the Village Council?

question: I will, Mims. Goodnight.
answer: Dada, what's a daikini?

question: Daikinis are giant people who live far far away.
answer: Are you scared? I could be you rguard! I could carry your spear!

question: What a great son you are, Ranon. I wish I could take you with me. Now go to sleep...
answer: Now, you know where you're going? Down there, through those trees, follow the river. You'll know the crossroads by a big daikini struc- ture. Willow, this is serious business. Don't waste any time, the outer world is no place for a Nelwyn. Give the baby to the first daikini you see, then hurry home as fast as you can.

question: If I'm not strong enough to be your apprentice, how can I do this?
answer: You're strong enough. But you're going to need courage, Willow.

question: I don't want courage. I don't want to be a warrior. All I've ever wanted was to do magic, real magic, like you!
answer: Real magic, Willow, is simply the art of controlling the reality of others. You lack faith in your- self. You must learn to trust your intuition. Go in the direction the bird is flying.

question: Oh, if I could do that I'd--I'd turn Burglekutt into a toad!
answer: Waste magic on revenge? You have much to learn, Willow...

question: I hate this. Where am I? I should stick you in a tree and go back home. I'm sorry. I didn't mean that. That's it. The crossroads... I hate this. I hate this. I really hate this.
answer: Hey, Peck...get me some water...or you'll diiiiie...!

question: I will--I'll getcha water--getcha lotsa water--anything you say--!
answer: Peck! You're a weasely little Peck! Gimme some water!

question: I'm not coming near you!
answer: Please? I'm dyin' of thirst in here.

question: Good. How long will it take?
answer: Don't make me angry, Peck.

question: You be careful. I'm a powerful sorcerer. I could turn you into a toad just like that.
answer: Miserable Pecks. That's more like it.

question: Do any other daikinis ever come by here?
answer: Why.

question: I have to give this baby to some- body.
answer: I'm somebody. Lemme out and I'll take care of your baby.

question: No. Somebdoy put you in there for a reason. I'll wait for somebody else. Hey! Somebody's coming!
answer: Peck! Quick! Douse the fire! No, you fool! Put it out I say! Out! No!! No! Help! Stop! Thanks for your help, Peck.

question: Are you okay?
answer: As if you care. I saved your life, Peck. Those guys woulda killed us! You wanna give your baby to them?? They eat babies!

question: I don't know.
answer: The world's gone insane. Good men locked in cages, criminals running free. It doesn't pay to be honest, Peck.

question: Don't call me a Peck. My name is Willow.
answer: Hello, Willow. I'm Madmartigan. You a woodcutter?

question: Farmer.
answer: Farmer! I knew it! You're a vic- tim, Willow. Yep, you and me Listen, Willow my friend. I'm really a good man. Give me my freedom, and I'll look after that baby for you. Trust me. That's it--good--good--like that, yes, good, good, the chain--that's it, come on--come on--!

question: Nooo, I don't think I should.
answer: Peck!! Stupid Peck! I'll kill ya! Let me out! Morning, Willow. Sorry I yelled at you. I've been in this cage toooo long. Can't think straight anymore. Owww...!

question: You all right?
answer: These burns. My arms. Ouch...

question: See if this helps.
answer: Aaaaaahhhh. Better. Here, I made something for the baby.

question: What's inside?
answer: A tooth. I'm strving. I got no used for it.

question: Stop! Wait!
answer: Smells like a battle.

question: Are you a warrior?
answer: The greatest swordsman that ever lived.

question: What's that? I hear something!
answer: You hear trouble.

question: What is it?
answer: A hundred horses...five or six wagons... and about six thousand fools.

question: We're going into battle, little one. Find a woman to take care of it.
answer: He thought you were a woman, Airk!

question: Madmartigan! What did you do this time?
answer: Nothing you wouldn't have done it my place!

question: I always knew you'd end up in a crow's cage.
answer: Least I'm not down there herding sheep!

question: You're lucky somebody got to you first, Madmartigan! I'd've killed you myself after that stunt at Land's End!
answer: Airk! Come on, Airk. Lemme outa here.

question: Hey, remember? You don't need my help, Madmartigan. Little rabbit trap like this? Come on! I could open it for you, but I wouldn't wanna insult you!
answer: Gimme a sword, Airk. I'll win your war for you.

question: You're nothing but trouble, Madmar- tigan. And I got plenty of that. Stay in your coffin and rot!
answer: I'll be around long after you're dead, Airk! You slime! When I get outa here I'll cut your head off and stick it on a pig-pole!

question: I'll be around long after you're dead, Airk! You slime! When I get outa here I'll cut your head off and stick it on a pig-pole!
answer: Friend of yours?

question: Hello, little baby... Whatcha thinkin' about, Willow?
answer: I hate this.

question: Nobody's gonna take your baby. Know why? Nobody cares... Except me. You wanna go back to your farm. You wanna go back to your family. I could take care of that baby. I'll look after her like she was me own.
answer: You don't know anything about ba- bies.

question: Ahhh! But I know a lot of women who do. Why, if I had somebody in my life--a little daughter for instance--I'd have a reason to live... Willow. You can't let me die here. Not when I wanna help you.
answer: You gotta promise to feed her.

question: I will.
answer: Fresh goat's milk.

question: Absolutely!
answer: And give her a bath everyday, and don't let her get cold. And keep her diaper changed.

question: Of course! I promise! Come to Daddy, little darlin'. I think she likes me!
answer: Here are her diaper rags. And this is her milk bladder. And when she cries--she's either hungry or she's tired--rock her on your left shoulder. She likes that.

question: Don't worry, Willow. She's in good hands. You haven't made a mistake.
answer: Bye. Please take good care of her.

question: You've done a great job. Now you go back to your family and get your crop in.
answer: Look, it's Willow Ufgood! He's come home! Welcome back, Willow! He deserves a medal Come back here, you! That's my baby!! Oh no, it's a trap! Oh noooooo!! Where am I? Where's the baby? That baby's my responsibility! Yeow! Madmartigan...I never should've trusted you...

question: We are emissaries of her majesty, Queen Cherlindrea, of the land of Coshairm.
answer: Queen Cherlindrea?

question: She requests the presence of your- self and the young princess.
answer: Who??

question: I can't see anything--she's too bright!
answer: I'm sorry... Broke-heart of nightingale for our honored guest. It is Elora Danan! The prophecy has come true.

question: You mean, you know who this baby belongs to?
answer: She belongs to all of us. She is the future queen and ruler of all kingdoms on earth.

question: What a relief. Now I can go home.
answer: No, Willow. Your journey has just begun. It has been foretold that this child shall bring about the downfall of Queen Bavmorda, whose evil powers have darkened our world. Upon you depends this princess's life.

question: Me?
answer: You are the guardian, Willow. You must take her to Tir Asleen.

question: What is Tir Asleen?
answer: It is a distant castle, where a great king and queen will look after Elora Danan and keep her safe until she is old enough to rule.

question: Where is Tir Asleen? How far is it?
answer: The way has been lost in time. But there is one person, a druid sor- ceress, who might guide you there. She was exiled by Queen Bavmorda many years ago. Her name is Fin Raziel.

question: You need a warrior for this job. I'm nobody.
answer: You are very important, Willow.

question: No I'm not. Have you really looked at me? I'm short! Even for a Nelwyn! Why can't you do it? You have mag- ical powers.
answer: My prsence cannot extend beyond this forest. But I can give you these... They will protect you. Use them wisely.

question: They look like acorns.
answer: Anything you hurl them at will turn to stone.

question: They're magic? Are you serious?
answer: I am very serious, Willow. There is no time to lose.

question: But I've got a family to think about! They need me! Hello...?
answer: Bavmord'a powers are growing like an evil plague. Soon she will con- trol the lives of you children, your wife, your village...everyone. The choice is yours.

question: You're crawling with rodents. How do you do.
answer: Hey! Give me that baby!

question: These Pecks make terrible nurse- maids.
answer: Nursemaid?!

question: They get too excited.
answer: Time to change her diaper.

question: Time to leave.
answer: You! Are you the mother of that child?

question: No. I mean yes.
answer: Let me see it.

question: I can't.
answer: Let me see it.

question: Madmartigan! Wait! We could've been killed, Madmarti- gan! Heeyah! Heeyah! Oh no! Woah...woah...!
answer: That girl is a vision.

question: Where's the baby??
answer: I thought you had her! Now Willow, I know you're gonna blame me for this but it wasn't my fault...!

question: Elora Danan!
answer: When I left the crossroads, I got ambushed by an elf!

question: Madmartigan! You saved her life!
answer: I did? I mean, of course I saved her life. She's almost my daughter, isn't she?

question: Not a bad idea. So you're on your way to Tir Asleen, huh? I hate to tell you this, Willow, but Tir Asleen dosn't exist.
answer: Yes it does. The Fairy Queen told me.

question: The Fairy Queen? And the baby here's a princess? And these two rodents are your guides? Yeah well...in the morning I think I'll be on my way.
answer: Madmartigan, I need your help.

question: My help? A great magician like you? You don't need any help.
answer: But you're a great swordsman! You're not a warrior, Madmartigan! A warrior wouldn't lie there and do nothing! We're in trouble! You've seen the big army that's after us! You're a fake! You're a bum! You're a-- you're a coward!!

question: What's with you, Peck?
answer: I miss my wife! I miss my chil- dren! My boy Ranon! He's growing up so fast, he even helps me on the farm now! And little Mims! If you ever saw her sweet little face you'd *melt* Madmartigan, you'd *melt*! Or maybe you wouldn't. You don't know anything about love. You don't know anything about any- thing...

question: I was in love once, Willow. She had a hold on my heart. I could barely function. I *was* a great swordsman! I was knighted! I could have been king!
answer: You?

question: Yeah me. King! But she betrayed me. She robbed me of my dream. I'll never fall in love again...
answer: Madmartigan! Madmartigan!

question: Without Raziel we'll never find Tir Asleen. We'd better go. Raziel? Hello? Fin Raziel?
answer: Get away! Get away! You'll die! You'll die! Who are you! Who are you!

question: I'm Willow Ufgood. I'm here to find Fin Raziel.
answer: That's me! Raziel! Raziel!

question: Raziel. Did you think my mother would allow you to escape? This is what we're looking for. It bears the markings.
answer: Don't worry, Willow. If there's one thing I'm good at, it's charm- ing a woman... So. Couldn't live without me, huh?

question: Lose your skirt? How embarassing.
answer: Still got what counts.

question: As above, so below.
answer: I'm all finished. Now what?

question: Burn it to a fine ash.
answer: How am I gonna do that?

question: Patience. Concentrate. You will find a way.
answer: What's going on?

question: This baby won't do what I say. You seem to know what to do. Here! Make it shut up.
answer: She needs to be changed.

question: I changed her already!
answer: She needs to be changed again. Sorsha crosses her arms in a hugg and watches as Willow changes the baby. Soon the baby stops crying. Re- lieved yet still anxious, Sorsha paces to a mirror. Willow rocks the baby gently, absently looking at the fire. Then his eyes focus on the fire.

question: Who is that horrible friend of yours?
answer: Madmartigan.

question: Who is he?
answer: I don't know much about him.

question: He's very bold. Do you really think my hair is beautiful?
answer: Uh, yes. It's very nice hair. She's hungry.

question: I know she's hungry. I tried to feed her but she wouldn't eat a thing. I'm not a wet nurse.
answer: Here. Hold her.

question: I tried everything. A spoon. I poured milk into her mouth, she just spat it out. I don't know what to do, I'm not a mother.
answer: Sometimes she likes it heated. She's a good baby. I did it! I got the ashes!

question: Did she ask about me?
answer: Who?

question: Come on, Peck, don't give me a hard time. You were in her ten all night. Did she say anything?
answer: She said lots of thing.s

question: Willow!
answer: She asked about you, Madmartigan.

question: You're crazy. I think you're in love.
answer: We don't have much time left! Go on! Go on!

question: I must concetrate my imagination...to creat a new...reality!
answer: What's the magician's weapon?

question: The limitless power of...
answer: Your will! Your will! What else could it be?

question: I can't remember all these things. What am I learning?
answer: The art of transformation!

question: But what am I gonna transform??
answer: Me!

question: The baby's cold. Take her.
answer: You remind me of your father, Sor- sha.

question: My father was a weakling.
answer: He was a great king. Not like your step-father, not like your mother. He ruled Tir Asleen with kindness, and a generous heart.

question: My mother calls that weakness.
answer: What do *you* call it?

question: I do what I'm told.
answer: Too bad you're not more like your father.

question: Tonight! Complete the philosopher's stone! I must be turned back!
answer: I'll do it, Raziel...

question: Let it settle. Carefully, slowly. Concentration and will. Now pour the water off.
answer: Oooh, this smells terrible.

question: That's the life spark. Exxence of magic and sorcery!
answer: Ouch!!

question: Shhhhh!
answer: What'd you bit me for!!

question: We need blood. To nourish the stone. charge the stone with ener- gy. The components of the stone are fusing... Again
answer: His will.

question: Now use it.
answer: I just wanted to test it first.

question: No! Change me back into a sor- ceress, Willow.
answer: Avaggdu, supriom, luwatha... What did I do?

question: I love you.
answer: One move, and you really will be a woman. You're a fool. Now put her back.

question: I'm not going to let this baby die.
answer: Don't make me kill you.

question: I believe you would...
answer: Why did you say that?

question: Say what?
answer: I love you.

question: Because it's true.
answer: I don't believe you.

question: I wish it weren't true. I swore I'd never let this happen. I hate you. I hate your beauty, I hate your innocence, I hate the feelings you've awakened in me. I'm in love with you, Sorsha. I don't want to be, but a power has enchanted me and I stand helpless against it. It's torture. Battle- field or prison cell was never half as cruel. I want you and I can't have you so I want you all the more. If this were another time and another place I'd--
answer: You'd what?

question: Willow! Willow! Are you all right? Help us.
answer: Madmartigan. Settled down with a family huh?

question: You left me to die, friend.
answer: You managed alright.

question: You gonna be a hero, Madmartigan? I've lost half my men fighting Kael, and Bavmorda, and the Nock- maar army. Now you and this Peck, and that magpie up in the rafters, are gonna take 'em on alone?
answer: Then come with us.

question: The war is here! In towns and vil- lages like this! You're chasing a dream.
answer: Just get me some horses. Once again, Airk, we say goodbye.

question: Madmartigan! I can't stand being in closed-in places.
answer: Want me to carry Elora?

question: I'm used to her. How's she doing?
answer: She's doing a lot better than we are, Peck. Willow...this may be a bad time to ask this question but...what if Raziel's wrong?

question: She can't be wrong. She's a very very very powerful sorceress.
answer: She's a bird, Willow.

question: That's my fault, not hers. I've got to keep practicing. I'm still in the learning stage but magic, Madmartigan, requires concentration and--
answer: Watch it!

question: Ahhh! I hate this.
answer: Go, Willow! Run! Run! Willow! Willow!

question: Turn them back, Willow!
answer: How??

question: Use the philosopher's stone! Hur- ry! Invocation! Release them!
answer: Beings within, beings without! Danu danu walkail funfawtha! I did it! Madmartigan! Come here! Look! You gotta see this! I did it!

question: Out for a little ride in the coun- try, Airk?
answer: Thought you might get lonely, Mad- martigan!

question: Thank you, friend.
answer: Let's go.

question: Kael!
answer: Queen Bavmorda. I have the child.

question: We must start the ritual! Who is that?
answer: An army of rebels and traitors.

question: Where is Sorsha?
answer: She has turned against you.

question: It's over, Willow. You did well. You protected yourself.
answer: I've come all this way and now Elora Dana's going to die!

question: No! I can still defeat Bavmorda!
answer: She's too powerful, Raziel

question: A true magician, Willow, never surrenders. She is a sorceress--I am a sorceress! Transform me now and I will destroy her! Hexagram!
answer: Banish all disturbing forces from this place. Fire, water, above and below. Balance. Balance. Bal- ance.

question: Don't give up! Willow!
answer: Raziel!

question: No, Willow!! I will face my mother alone.
answer: Sorsha!!

question: I won't let you kill her!
answer: You are a weakling. Like you fa- ther! Can you not see that I am about to become all-powerful!

question: No!!
answer: Raziel...!!

question: Raziel...!!
answer: The baby will be queen. It has been foretold, Bavmorda.

question: My ritual will kill the prophecy! Now the child dies with it, its en- ergy exiled into oblivion! You see? I hold the power of the universe!
answer: Not until your ritual is complete!

question: And who will stop me? The elements are slaves to my command!
answer: There is no one who can match your sorcery. Except me!

question: As above, so below! Universe of evil, Raziel! It conquers even you! *Stop! Bring back that child!!!* Who are you?
answer: I'm Willow Ufgood. I'm a magician. I'm a *great* magician.

question: Is that the extent of your power? Place it on the altar.
answer: No. You can't have her.

question: By ritual, by sorcery, I well draw the lightning and send this child into the destructive realm.
answer: And with my magic I'll send her into the...into the...

question: You're no magician.
answer: Into the good.
